InfoFrame.name: Software created by Tommaso Bocchietti
InfoFrame.text_1: You will need an Arduino-controlled printer like the one in the picture
InfoFrame.text_2: Please note: by browsing through menus you can find useful links for the project

ConfigFrame.text_0:
Set up your printer


1. Enter the port to which the Arduino board is connected:
ConfigFrame.text_1: 2. Download the library 'AFmotor.h' (link in the menu)
ConfigFrame.text_2: 3. Upload the following code to your Arduino board

CalibrationFrame.setting_text_6:
Manually bring the pen
to the position of the red dot

PrintImgFrame.setting_text_0: Choose the image you want to print
PrintImgFrame.setting_text_1:
Use the slider to adjust the approximation
of contours in the image

PrintHandFrame.setting_text_0: Use the board beside to draw
PrintHandFrame.setting_text_2:
- Click and drag the cursor
- Stay within the black border
PrintHandFrame.setting_text_3: Drawing and printing will be simultaneous

PrintTextFrame.setting_text_0: Write the text and set the parameters

set_calibration_params_: Initial parameters for the Arduino printer. Do not modify the file.
The parameters for the pen must be between 0 and 180
error_msg: Switch to 'Configure' to reconnect the Arduino
Switch to 'Calibrate' to test the initial setting
